page.title: 06Transport around Alton.
page.content:
In Alton and Holybourne, until they built a{by-pass}in 1971, there used to be lots of traffic on the roads and it took about half an hour to get through Alton and Holybourne. Today there is much less traffic.
Alton's{railway station}serves as an interchange between British Rail to London, and the private 'Watercress' steam line to Alresford. {The} {Watercress Line}opened as a private railway line in 1977, following British Railway's closure of the line in 1973, but the final link from Medstead to Alton was not re-opened until 1985.
